nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
## Automated Article Scheduling

**1. Fast Bulk Article Generation**
Quickly create multiple AI-generated articles.
Efficiently streamline content creation.
Reduces manual effort while maintaining quality.

**2. Workflow Testing Before Execution**
Manually test the workflow for debugging.
Ensure each step runs as expected.
Optimize before full automation.

**3. Automated & Randomized Publishing**
Schedule posts at predefined intervals.
Introduce random delays for a natural posting pattern.
Prevents overly predictable publishing behavior.

nodes.notes: This scheduleTrigger node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
## AI Content Generating

**Automatic Content & Keyword Generation

- Use your own prompt to start
- ChatGPT generates full-length articles with structured headings.
- Extracts relevant image search keywords for visual enhancement.
- To implement this, add the following prompt (green note) below your workflow:

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
(YOUR PROMPT) **Image Search Keywords (For Visual Alignment)** - Automatically generates 3-5 English keywords for image searches based on the article content. - Keywords should be specific objects, locations, or atmospheres rather than abstract concepts. **Article Formatting Requirements** 1️⃣ Title (H1): Ensure unique and trend-driven headlines. 2️⃣ H2 / H3 Subheadings: Structure content in an SEO-optimized format. 3️⃣ Article Structure (Enhanced Readability) ** Introduction ** - Go straight to the point, avoiding excessive background. - Use question hooks or market trend data to engage readers. ** Core Content ** - Include at least three knowledge points to ensure depth. - Balance short and long sentences for better flow. ** Conclusion ** - Avoid generic AI-style summaries; instead, provide insights or actionable takeaways. - Optionally include a CTA (Call to Action). ** HTML Formatting ** Ensure the article is properly structured in HTML format: - Headings: Use

,

,

appropriately. - Paragraphs: Enclose text within

. - Emphasized Words: Use to highlight key terms. - Lists: Use

    and
  • for bullet points. Ensure a clean, well-structured output instead of plain text. ### **Final JSON Format Ensure the output follows this structure: { "title": "{Generate an H1 title that aligns with market trends, ensures high click-through rates, and follows keyword strategy}", "content": "{Generate a complete HTML article including H1, H2, H3 headings, paragraphs, lists, etc.}", "keywords": ["{Image search keyword 1}", "{Image search keyword 2}", "{Image search keyword 3}", "{Image search keyword 4}", "{Image search keyword 5}"] }

nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content:
## Introduction: WordPress automatically publishes posts and inserts the first image

It is **highly recommended to install the Featured Image from URL (FIFU) plugin** and enable:

**Auto > Set Featured Media Automatically from Content.** before you generate contents.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Automated Content Generation & Publishing - Wordpress

## Overview
Automated workflow: Automated Content Generation & Publishing - Wordpress. This workflow integrates 10 different services: stickyNote, wordpress, httpRequest, wait, code. It contains 21 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 21
- **Node Types**: 10
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Create posts on Wordpress**: wordpress
- **Processing Delay**: code
- **Random Wait**: wait
- **Save to Sheet**: googleSheets
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **1. Auto Start**: scheduleTrigger
- **2. When clicking ‘Test workflow’**: manualTrigger
- **3. Schedule Your Posts**: scheduleTrigger
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note2**: stickyNote
- ... and 11 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
